info.name: Undetectable Local API
info.description:
With the API v1.5 in Undetectable, you will be able to get a list of profiles, create, launch, update, and close them. Additionally, with the obtained information, you can connect various automation tools such as Puppeteer, Playwright, Selenium and others to profiles on the Chromium core.

Also check our documentation: https://docs.undetectable.io/en/

You can download Chromedriver for working with Selenium here:

  • Windows

  • MacOS M series

  • MacOS Intel

The program must be running to work with the API.

By default, the local server runs on port 25325. If this port is occupied, it will start on another port. You can check the port in the program settings and change it if necessary.

To access the local server, use the IP: 127.0.0.1, localhost, or the local IP within your network, and the port from the settings plus the path you want to execute, for example, http://localhost:25325/status.

API Responses

All API responses look like:

{
"code": `<status code>`,
"status": `<status>`,
"data": `<return object>`,
}

where status code and status reflect the status:

status code status Description
0 "success" success
1 "error" error, = {"error":"error description"}

return object - various data sent by the API, for example, a list of profiles.

Errors have the following format:

{
    "code":1,
    "status":"error",
    "data":
    {"error": "error description"},
}

ðŸ”´ - Required parametr in request

request.description: Returns the status of the local server, whether it is running or not.
Returns a list of profiles available in the program on the Chromium browser

response.name: Get browser profiles list (success)

request.description: Requests information about the profile with the selected

response.name: Get browser profile info (success)
response.body:
{
    "code": 0,
    "status": "success",
    "data": {
        "name": "Profile1", // Profile name in the program
        "status": "Available", // Profile status, can be: "Started","Locked", "Available"
        "debug_port": "xxxx", // browser debug port, used for automation (empty if profile is not running)
        "websocket_link": "ws://127.0.0.1:xxxx/devtools/browser/xxxxxx", // browser link, used for automation (empty if profile is not running)
        "configid": "id", // Config ID
        "cloud_id": "",
        "type": "cloud", // Profile type: cloud, local
        "proxy": "socks5://127.0.0.1:5555:login:pass", // Profile proxy
        "folder": "Name", // Profile folder name
        "tags": [
            "tag1",
            "tag2",
            "tag3"
        ], // Profile tags
        "notes": "Text", // Profile notes
        "useragent": "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/114.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/114.0.1823.43", // Profile useragent
        "browser": "Edge 114.0.1823.43", // Profile browser
        "os": "Windows 10", // Profile OS
        "screen": "1366x768", // Profile screen resolution
        "language": "en-US,en;q=0.9,ak-GH;q=0.8,ak;q=0.7", // Profile language
        "cpu": 8, // Number of cores
        "memory": 4, // Amount of memory
        "creation_date": 123456789, // Creation date Unix Timestamp
        "modify_date": 123456789 // Modification date Unix Timestamp
    },
    ...
}

request.description:
Starts the profile with the selected profileID. You can add parameters to the link.

  • chrome_flags and pass any launch flags you want, just encode them in URL encoding, for example:

    • ?chrome_flags=--blink-settings=imagesEnabled=false --disable-webgl2

    • ?chrome_flags=--headless=new

  • start-pages and specify the start pages, just encode them in URL encoding, for example:

    • ?start-pages=https://google.com,https://facebook.com

description.content: Add any launch flags you want, just encode them in URL encoding.
Add start pages, just encode them in URL encoding.

response.name: Start profile (success)

query.description: Add any launch flags you want, just encode them in URL encoding, for example: ?chrome_flags=--blink-settings%3DimagesEnabled%3Dfalse%20--disable-webgl2 ?chrome_flags=--headless%3Dnew
Add start pages, just encode them in URL encoding, for example: ?start-pages=https%3A%2F%2Fgoogle.com%2Chttps%3A%2F%2Fya.ru

request.description: Stops the profile with the selected profileID

Creates a profile with the selected parameters. All parameters are optional and may not be present.

The list of browsers for the command:

  • Chrome

  • Edge

  • FireFox

  • IE

  • Opera

  • Safari

  • Yandex

The list of OS for the command:

  • Windows

  • Windows 7

  • Windows 8

  • Windows 8.1

  • Windows 10

  • Android

  • iPhone

  • iPad

  • Linux

  • Mac.

If there are no configurations with the selected OS or Browser, a random OS or Browser type will be used.

Request params

Type Description Values
name string Profile name.
os string Configuration with which OS to use. OS list
browser string Configuration with which browser to use. Browser list
cpu int Number of cores, possible values. 32, 24, 20, 16, 12, 10, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, 0
memory int Amount of memory, possible values. 8, 4, 2, 1, 0
tags array Tags list
geolocation string Set geolocation, if you enter an empty or incorrect value, the default settings will be used.
resolution string Screen resolution "800x600", "960x540", "1024x768", "1152x864", "1280x720", "1280x768", "1280x800", "1280x1024", "1366x768", "1408x792", "1440x900", "1400x1050", "1440x1080", "1536x864", "1600x900", "1600x1024", "1600x1200", "1680x1050", "1920x1080", "1920x1200", "2048x1152", "2560x1080", "2560x1440", "3440x1440", "3840x2160", "5120x1440"
proxy string Proxy in the profile Proxies can be http, https, socks5, there may be options with and without login/password. You can use proxy ID too.
notes string Notes
folder string Folder
language string Languages, you can set up to 2 languages
cookies array Cookies
type string Profile type "cloud", "local"
group string If there is no entered group, it takes from the default settings, if there is and it is incorrect, an error is displayed
configid string Config ID, if entered, then the OS and Browser parameters are ignored. Other parameters if possible, for example, if the config is for Android, the screen resolution will not change
accounts array Import credentials for different sites into the profile
timezone string Set timezone or timezone mode timezone modes: "Auto", "System"
webrtc string Webrtc
auto_allow_geo string

response.name: Create profile (success)

request.description:
Updates the information in the profile with the specified profileID. All parameters are optional and may not be present.

Request params

Type Description Values
name string Profile name.
tags array Tags list
geolocation string Set geolocation, if you enter an empty or incorrect value, the default settings will be used.
proxy string Proxy in the profile Proxies can be http, https, socks5, there may be options with and without login/password. You can use proxy ID too.
notes string Notes
folder string Folder
cookies array Cookies
type string Profile type ["cloud", "local"]
group string If there is no entered group, it takes from the default settings, if there is and it is incorrect, an error is displayed
accounts array Import credentials for different sites into the profile
timezone string Set timezone or timezone mode timezone modes: "Auto", "System"
Deletes the profile with the selected profileID

Checks the connection in the profile with the selected profileID, if the check fails, an error is returned.

data.ip - Returns the IP address in this profile

Sends the selected profiles to the cloud.

Request params

Type Description Values
ðŸ”´ group string Group name.
ðŸ”´ profiles array List of profiles ID.

Makes the selected profiles local.

Request params

Type Description Values
ðŸ”´ profiles array List of profiles ID.
Updates the browser version to the latest in the profile with the selected profileID
Clear only cache from profile with selected profileID
Clears all data (cookies, history, notes, cache, etc.) of the profile with the selected profileID

Import selected profiles.

Request params

Type Description Values
ðŸ”´ path string Path to file.
ðŸ”´ dir string Path to folder with profiles.

Export profiles to specific folder.

Request params

Type Description Values
ðŸ”´ profiles array List of profiles ID.
ðŸ”´ dir string Path to folder for profiles export
Requests the cookies of the profile with the selected profileID
Clear only cookies from profile with selected profileID
Returning proxies list

Request params

Add a proxy to the proxy manager, the parameters login, password, ipchangelink are optional, the rest are required.

Param Type Description Values
ðŸ”´ name string Proxy name.
ðŸ”´ type string Proxy type. ["http", "socks5"]
ðŸ”´ host string Proxy hostname.
ðŸ”´ port string Proxy port.
login string Proxy login.
password string Proxy password.
ipchangelink string Link for changing IP (mobile proxy).

Removes a proxy with the selected proxyID.

Proxy will be deleted for all profiles with that proxy, the same as during normal deletion from the Proxy Manager.
Updates the proxy with the selected proxyID, all parameters are optional.
Returns a list of Cloud groups
Returns a list of active configurations

response.name: Get configurations list (success)

request.description: Returning timezones list
Fully close software

item.name: Puppeteer
item.description:
Node.js example

Node.js Puppeteer Launch a profile with a specific name and open the undetectable.io page in that profile:

Install requirements:

pnpm install puppeteer

pnpm install axios

const axios = require("axios");
const puppeteer = require("puppeteer");

const PROFILE_NAME = "test";
const API_URL = "http://127.0.0.1:25325";

// Function to introduce a delay in execution
const sleep = (ms) => new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, ms));

// Function to check if the API is available
async function getStatus(url) {
  try {
    const response = await axios.get(`${url}/status`);
    return response.data.code === 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error("Error fetching status:", error);
    return false;
  }
}

// Function to fetch the list of available profiles
async function getProfiles(url) {
  try {
    const response = await axios.get(`${url}/list`);
    return response.data.data;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error("Error fetching profiles:", error);
    return [];
  }
}

// Function to start a profile using the given profile ID
async function startProfile(url, profileId) {
  try {
    const response = await axios.get(`${url}/profile/start/${profileId}`);
    return response.data.data;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error("Error starting profile:", error);
    return false;
  }
}

// Function to connect Puppeteer to the browser via a WebSocket link
async function connectToBrowser(websocketLink) {
  return await puppeteer.connect({
    browserWSEndpoint: websocketLink,
    defaultViewport: null,
  });
}

// Function to open a new page and navigate to the specified URL
async function newPage(browser, url) {
  const page = await browser.newPage();
  await sleep(1000);
  await page.goto(url);
  return page;
}

// Main function
async function main() {
  if (!(await getStatus(API_URL))) {
    console.error("Profile manager is not available.");
    return;
  }

  const profiles = await getProfiles(API_URL);

  for (const profileId in profiles) {
    if (profiles[profileId].name === PROFILE_NAME) {
      const profile = await startProfile(API_URL, profileId);
      const browser = await connectToBrowser(profile.websocket_link);
      const page = await newPage(browser, "https://undetectable.io");

      await sleep(2000);

      // Waits for a new tab to open while clicking a 'Sign Up' link
      const [redirectedPage] = await Promise.all([
        new Promise((resolve) =>
          browser.once("targetcreated", (target) => resolve(target.page()))
        ),
        // Click on the first link with text "Sign Up"
        page.evaluate(() => {
          const link = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll("a")).find(
            (a) => a.textContent.trim() === "Sign Up"
          );
          if (link) link.click();
        }),
      ]);

      await redirectedPage.bringToFront();
      await page.waitForFunction(() => document.readyState === "complete", { timeout: 5000 });
      console.log("New tab is ready");

      await sleep(2000);

      await browser.close();
      break;
    }
  }
}

main().catch(console.error);

item.name: Selenium
item.description:
Python example

Python + Selenium Launch profiles located in a specific folder and open multiple websites:

from time import sleep
import requests
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.service import Service
address = "127.0.0.1" # Local API IP address (if you work from another PC on the same network or a port is open in the router settings, you can access the local API remotely and this address will need to be changed)
port_from_settings_browser = '25325' # Local API port (can be found in the program settings)
chrome_driver_path = "chromedriver.exe" # Path to chromedriver for v110
ser = Service(chrome_driver_path)
chrome_options = Options()
list_response = requests.get(f'http://{address}:{port_from_settings_browser}/list').json()['data'] # Send a request to the local API to get a list of profiles
profile_id = ''
for key, value in list_response.items(): # Loop through the list of profiles and run them one by one
        if value['folder'] == 'test': # Here you can add a check to run only the profiles you need (in this example, we run the profiles that are in the 'test' folder)
            profile_id = key
            if value['status'] == 'Available': # If the profile is not running, then run the profile and take the debug_port
                start_profile_response = requests.get(f'http://{address}:{port_from_settings_browser}/profile/start/{profile_id}', timeout=5).json()['data']
                debug_port = start_profile_response['debug_port']
            if value['status'] == 'Started': # If the profile is running, then we simply take the debug_port from the available data
                debug_port = value['debug_port']
            if value['status'] == 'Locked': # If the profile is Locked, then skip
                continue
            if debug_port: # We check if the browser has a connection port (WebEngine profiles doesnt have ports, so we close them immediately)
                chrome_options.debugger_address = f'{address}:{debug_port}'
                driver = webdriver.Chrome(service=ser, options=chrome_options)
                driver.get("https://whoer.net/") # Open whoer.net in active tab
                driver.switch_to.new_window('tab') # Create a new tab and switch to it
                driver.get(url='https://browserleaks.com/js') # Open browserleaks.com/js in active tab
                # You can add any other actions here
            sleep(5) # Wait 5 sec
            requests.get(f'http://{address}:{port_from_settings_browser}/profile/stop/{profile_id}') # Stop profile
